name: Stanford University
description: A world-renowned private research university, known for its academic prestige, picturesque campus, and pioneering contributions to innovation.

name: Apple Infinite Loop Campus
description: Apple’s classic corporate campus, known for its sleek architecture and role in Apple’s history and innovation.

name: Apple Park Visitor Center
description: A visitor center for Apple’s futuristic Apple Park campus, featuring a café, store with exclusive merchandise, and a rooftop viewing deck.

name: Googleplex
description: Google’s main headquarters, known for its innovative design, bike-friendly campus, and environment fostering creativity.

name: Levi's Stadium
description: Home to the San Francisco 49ers, this state-of-the-art stadium hosts football games, concerts, and large-scale events.

name: Google Bay View
description: An expansion of Google’s office space featuring sustainable design, modern architecture, and energy-efficient structures.

name: Santana Row
description: A stylish shopping and dining district with upscale boutiques, international restaurants, and a European-influenced streetscape.

name: California's Great America
description: A popular amusement park offering roller coasters, family rides, shows, and a water park.

name: Fremont Older Preserve
description: A scenic open space preserve offering hiking and horseback riding trails, panoramic views, and a tranquil natural environment.

name: Picchetti Ranch Preserve
description: An open space preserve known for its historic winery buildings, orchards, and well-maintained hiking trails.

name: Shoreline Park
description: A large waterfront park with walking and biking paths, a sailing lake, a golf course, and picnic areas.

name: HP Garage
description: The birthplace of Silicon Valley, where Hewlett-Packard got its start, symbolizing early tech entrepreneurship.

name: The Tech Interactive
description: A hands-on science and technology museum in San Jose offering interactive exhibits and educational programs.

name: Winchester Mystery House
description: A Victorian mansion famous for its architectural oddities and secret passages, now a popular tourist attraction.

name: Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum
description: A museum showcasing the largest collection of Egyptian artifacts on display in the western U.S.

name: The Computer History Museum
description: A museum dedicated to the evolution of computing technology, showcasing rare artifacts and interactive exhibits.

name: Apple Garage
description: The suburban garage where Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak founded Apple, sparking a technological revolution.

name: Intel Museum
description: A museum chronicling the semiconductor industry and Intel’s contributions, featuring interactive and educational exhibits.

name: Santa Clara University
description: A private Jesuit university known for its academic excellence, historic campus, and mission-driven education.

name: Main Street Cupertino
description: A vibrant mixed-use development offering a variety of restaurants, shops, and cafés, popular for dining and leisure.

name: Meta Headquarters
description: Home to Meta (Facebook), known for its social media innovation and modern, collaborative office designs.

name: San Pedro Square Market
description: A lively market in downtown San Jose with diverse food vendors, bars, live entertainment, and a historic ambiance.
